snippet: Lewis Katz, an owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer, died along with six other people when a private jet erupted into a ball of fire as it took off outside Boston.
abstract: Lewis Katz, philanthropist and co-owner of Philadelphia Inquirer, is among seven people killed in fiery plane crash outside Boston; was embarking on a last-minute outing to Concord, Mass, with longtime friend and neighbor Anne Leeds and others, to help support a nonprofit education effort.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Katharine Q. Seelye reported from Boston and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Lewis Katz, an owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer, died along with six other people when a private jet erupted into a ball of fire as it took off outside Boston.

headline.main: Philadelphia Inquirer Co-Owner Among 7 Killed in Massachusetts Plane Crash
headline.print_headline: Fiery Fatal Jet Crash Ended an Outing to Support an Education Effort
